item.title: 据 Information 报道，OpenAI 讨论以约 7500 亿美元的估值融资数百亿美元
item.description: 据《信息报》周三报道，OpenAI 已与一些投资者就以约 7500 亿美元的估值进行融资一事进行了初步谈判。【原文：OpenAI has held preliminary talks with some investors about raising at a valuation of around $750 billion, the Information reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 福特取消电动汽车电池交易后，韩国 LGES 股价下跌超过 7
item.description: LG Energy Solution 公司在一天前宣布福特汽车公司取消了一项电动汽车（EV）电池供应协议，该公司股价在周四早盘交易中最高下跌了 7.6%。【原文：Shares of LG Energy Solution dropped as much as 7.6% in morning trade on Thursday after the company announced a day earlier that Ford Motor had cancelled an electric vehicle (EV) battery supply deal.】

item.title: 独家报道亚马逊、沃尔玛股东推动公司报告特朗普移民政策的影响
item.description: 据路透社看到的文件显示，一个与工会结盟的投资团体周三致函亚马逊、沃尔玛和 Alphabet，询问美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的移民政策如何影响它们的财务和供应链。【原文：A union-aligned investment group sent letters to Amazon, Walmart and Alphabet on Wednesday, asking how U.S. President Donald Trump's immigration policies were impacting their finances and supply chains, according to the documents seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 在香港上市的百威啤酒亚太区首席财务官 Lares 将于明年离职
item.description: 百威啤酒亚太区公司（Budweiser Brewing Company APAC）周四表示，其首席财务官伊格纳西奥-拉雷斯（Ignacio Lares）在服务近二十年后，决定从 2026 年 4 月 1 日起离开公司。【原文：Budweiser Brewing Company APAC said on Thursday that its chief financial officer, Ignacio Lares, had decided to leave the company effective April 1, 2026, after nearly two decades of service.】

item.title: 独家报道消息称美国联邦贸易委员会调查 Instacart 的人工智能定价工具，股价下跌
item.description: 两名熟悉内情的消息人士告诉路透社，美国联邦贸易委员会正在调查Instacart，因为该零售平台因其人工智能驱动的定价工具而面临批评。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission is probing Instacart , two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters, as the retail platform faces criticism over its artificial intelligence-driven pricing tool.】

item.title: 美国原油期货在亚洲交易中因特朗普封锁委内瑞拉而跳涨
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对进出委内瑞拉的油轮实施封锁后，美国原油期货周四在亚洲交易时段开盘上涨一美元，该国的大部分出口仍被搁置。【原文：U.S. crude futures opened a dollar higher in Asian trading on Thursday after President Donald Trump placed a blockade on tankers entering and leaving Venezuela and most exports from the country remained on hold.】

item.title: 英伟达董事哈维-琼斯出售持有三十多年的 4,400 万美元股票
item.description: 周三的一份监管文件显示，Nvidia 董事会成员哈维-琼斯（Harvey Jones）出售了价值超过 4400 万美元的公司股票。【原文：Nvidia board member Harvey Jones sold more than $44 million worth of company stock, a regulatory filing showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 非同小可：中国企业将珍贵树木和茶叶转化为数字资产
item.description: 在中国的热带岛屿海南，人们正在对黄花梨树（一种稀有的红木）进行拍照，以便将其转化为数字资产。【原文：On the Chinese tropical island of Hainan, Huanghuali trees - a rare kind of rosewood - are being photographed so that they can be turned into digital assets.】

item.title: 零售业战火升温，Coinbase 进军股票交易和活动合约领域
item.description: Coinbase 周三表示，它将开始让用户交易股票和与现实世界结果挂钩的事件合约，因为该交易所已超越其加密货币的根基，与竞争对手展开更直接的竞争。【原文：Coinbase said on Wednesday it will start letting users trade stocks and event contracts tied to real-world outcomes, as the exchange expands beyond its crypto roots to compete more directly with rivals.】

item.title: 澳新银行遭遇第二次 "罢工"，股东对薪酬报告提出异议
item.description: 澳大利亚澳新银行集团的新任首席执行官将放弃今年的短期奖金，而在 2025 年的年度股东大会上，有相当一部分股东反对该银行的高管薪酬报告。【原文：Australian lender ANZ Group's new CEO will forgo his short-term bonus this year, while a significant minority of shareholders opposed the bank's executive pay report at its 2025 annual general meeting.】

item.title: 英国石油公司任命梅格-奥尼尔为首席执行官，奥金克斯卸任
item.description: 石油和天然气巨头英国石油公司（BP）周三任命梅格-奥尼尔（Meg O'Neill）为首席执行官，自2026年4月1日起生效，默里-奥金克洛斯（Murray Auchincloss）卸任首席执行官一职。【原文：Oil and gas major BP on Wednesday appointed Meg O'Neill as its chief executive officer, effective April 1, 2026, as Murray Auchincloss stepped down from the role.】

item.title: 交易日：科技股下滑，石油飙升
item.description: 美国股市周三下挫，科技股受到人工智能贸易忧虑重燃的打击，而华盛顿对进出委内瑞拉的所有受制裁油轮的封锁则使油价从五年来的低点回升。【原文：U.S. shares sank on Wednesday, with tech hit by renewed worries over the AI trade, while Washington's blockade of all sanctioned oil tankers entering and leaving Venezuela lifted oil prices from their five-year lows.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称，高盛聘请 Qatalyst 联合创始人 Cayne 推动软件银行业务发展
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，高盛集团已聘请精品科技投资银行 Qatalyst Partners 的联合创始人 Brian Cayne 担任其软件投资银行部的全球联席主管。【原文：Goldman Sachs Group has hired Brian Cayne, a co-founder of boutique tech investment bank Qatalyst Partners, as a global co-head of its software investment banking group, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 消息人士称，艾伯维和其他几家制药公司接近与特朗普达成最惠国待遇协议
item.description: 据熟悉情况的消息人士透露，艾伯维和其他几家制药商预计将于周五宣布与美国政府达成降低某些处方药价格的协议，并满足唐纳德-特朗普总统提出的其他要求。【原文：AbbVie and several other drugmakers are expected to announce on Friday agreements with the U.S. government to lower certain prescription drug prices and meet other demands made by President Donald Trump, according to sources familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 芯片制造商美光预测季度收入高于预期
item.description: 美光科技公司（Micron Technology）周三预测第二季度营收将高于华尔街预期，该公司押注于人工智能硬件中使用的高带宽内存芯片的需求飙升和强劲定价。【原文：Micron Technology forecast second-quarter revenue above Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, betting on soaring demand and strong pricing for its high-bandwidth memory chips used in artificial intelligence hardware.】

item.title: 路威酩轩集团首席执行官阿尔诺：10年后再问我继任计划
item.description: 路威酩轩集团首席执行官贝尔纳-阿尔诺（Bernard Arnault）在被问及全球最大奢侈品集团的继任计划时表示，他希望自己能够再干十年。【原文：LVMH CEO Bernard Arnault said he was hoping he would be able to make another ten years when asked about his succession plans for the world's biggest luxury group.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，美国联邦储备委员会终止要求花旗银行改进风险控制的通知
item.description: 据知情人士透露，美国联邦储备委员会已告知花旗集团，它已关闭了要求该银行修复交易风险管理缺陷的正式通知，这是在改善监督和控制缺陷方面迈出的重要一步，这些缺陷曾使这家美国第三大银行陷入困境。【原文：The U.S. Federal Reserve has told Citigroup that it has closed formal notices requiring the bank to fix trading risk management weaknesses, according to people with knowledge of the matter, a significant step in improving oversight and control deficiencies that have bogged down the third largest U.S. bank.】

item.title: 卡夫亨氏新任首席执行官将负责公司分拆和可能的资产出售
item.description: 据银行家、分析师和一位前高管透露，卡夫亨氏决定启用史蒂夫-卡希莱恩（Steve Cahillane）--这位曾指导凯洛格完成包装食品行业最大一次分拆的交易者--这表明，这家番茄酱生产商在推进自身分拆的同时，可能正在为重大资产出售做准备。【原文：Kraft Heinz's decision to tap Steve Cahillane - the dealmaker who steered Kellogg through one of the packaged food industry's biggest breakups - signals the ketchup maker may be positioning itself for major asset sales as it pushes ahead with its own split, according to bankers, analysts and a former executive.】

item.title: 亚马逊聘请资深人士彼得-德桑蒂斯领导人工智能、芯片和量子技术的推进工作
item.description: 亚马逊周三任命长期担任云计算高管的彼得-德桑蒂斯（Peter DeSantis）领导一个新部门，负责监管其最先进的技术，包括人工智能模型、定制硅片和量子计算。【原文：Amazon on Wednesday tapped long-time cloud executive Peter DeSantis to lead a new unit that would oversee its most advanced technologies, including artificial intelligence models, custom silicon and quantum computing.】

item.title: 联合太平洋公司与诺福克南方公司的交易再次遭到卡车司机工会的反对
item.description: 卡车司机工会周三表示，反对美国货运铁路联合太平洋公司和诺福克南方公司的合并提议。【原文：The Teamsters union said on Wednesday it opposes the proposed merger between U.S. freight railroads Union Pacific and Norfolk Southern .】

item.title: 彭博新闻社报道：诺华与罗氏接近达成美国药品价格协议
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周三援引知情人士的话报道，白宫最快将于周五宣布与制药巨头诺华和罗氏控股公司达成的药品定价协议。【原文：The White House is set to announce drug pricing deals with pharmaceutical giants Novartis and Roche Holding as soon as Friday, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 凯雷聘请高盛参与卢克石油资产竞购
item.description: 美国私募股权巨头凯雷（Carlyle）已聘请高盛（Goldman Sachs）参与竞购卢克石油公司（Lukoil）资产，两位熟悉此事的消息人士周三向路透社透露了这一消息。【原文：U.S. private equity giant Carlyle has hired Goldman Sachs to work on its bid for Lukoil assets, two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Wednesday, as the race for the sanctioned Russian oil firm's overseas portfolio heats up.】

item.title: 完美风暴推动白银突破 65 美元/盎司，创历史新高
item.description: 对白银的强劲投资需求、白银被列入美国重要矿产清单以及一轮势头强劲的买盘推动白银价格创下历史新高，使白银价格在2025年收盘时达到了年初价格的两倍多。【原文：Robust investment demand for silver, its inclusion on the U.S. critical minerals list, and a wave of momentum buying have propelled the white metal to a fresh record high, setting prices up to close out 2025 at more than double the level at which they began.】

item.title: 路透社报道后，共和党议员谴责英特尔测试与中国有关的工具
item.description: 共和党议员本周指责英特尔威胁美国国家安全，因为路透社披露这家芯片制造商正在评估一家与中国关系密切的公司生产的芯片制造设备，而这家公司的海外分支机构受到了美国政府的制裁。【原文：Republican lawmakers accused Intel this week of threatening U.S. national security after Reuters revealed the chipmaker was evaluating chipmaking equipment made by a company with deep ties to China and overseas units sanctioned by the U.S. government.】

item.title: 波兰金融监管机构为 Erste 收购桑坦德银行开绿灯
item.description: 波兰金融监管机构（KNF）周三发表声明称，已为 Erste Group Bank AG 收购 Santander Bank Polska 控股权的交易开了绿灯。【原文：The Polish financial regulator (KNF) has given a green light to Erste Group Bank AG’s purchase of a controlling stake in Santander Bank Polska , it said in a statement on Wednesday.】

item.title: Telefonica 因成本和行政负担从纽约证券交易所退市美国存托股票
item.description: 西班牙电信巨头西班牙电信公司（Telefonica）周三表示，将把其美国存托股票（ADS）从纽约证券交易所退市，理由是维持其上市的行政负担和成本。【原文：Spanish telecoms giant Telefonica said on Wednesday it would delist its American Depositary Shares (ADS) from the New York Stock Exchange, citing the administrative burden and cost of keeping them listed.】

item.title: 安达信税务公司估值 23 亿美元，纽交所首日股价大涨
item.description: 安达信集团的股票周三在纽约证交所首次亮相时大涨约 31%，这家税务咨询公司的估值达到 23 亿美元，因为投资者押注于这个长期与审计质量相关的品牌，认为它的声誉包袱已经超过了审计质量。【原文：Andersen Group's shares jumped about 31% in their debut on the NYSE on Wednesday, valuing the tax advisory firm at $2.3 billion, as investors bet on the brand long-associated with audit quality outweighing its reputational baggage.】

item.title: 机身出现缺陷后，监管部门下令对部分空客A320飞机进行检查
item.description: 欧洲安全当局周三发布初步指示，要求航空公司检查数十架A320系列喷气机的机身面板，此前一家西班牙供应商的生产问题导致空中客车公司放慢了交付速度。【原文：European safety authorities issued preliminary instructions on Wednesday requiring airlines to inspect fuselage panels on dozens of A320-family jets after a production problem at a Spanish supplier prompted Airbus to slow deliveries.】

item.title: 备忘录称摩根大通任命 Edward Byun 为 ECM 技术全球主管
item.description: 根据路透社周三看到的一份备忘录，摩根大通任命 Edward Byun 为技术股权资本市场（ECM）全球主管，常驻旧金山。【原文：JPMorgan named Edward Byun as its global head of technology equity capital markets, or ECM, based in San Francisco, according to a memo seen by Reuters on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美联储主席沃勒尔表示 "绝对 "会捍卫美国中央银行的独立性
item.description: 美联储理事克里斯托弗-沃勒（Christopher Waller）是明年接替美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）的候选人之一，他周三表示，如果央行的独立性受到美国总统的挑战，他将 "绝对 "捍卫央行的独立性。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller, who is on the short list to succeed Fed Chair Jerome Powell next year, said on Wednesday he would "absolutely" defend the central bank's independence if it were challenged by a U.S. president.】
